0x0000000c.description: NBI DMA Buffer List Queue Event Control
0x0000000c.name: NbiDmaBlqEvent

0x00000010.description: NBI DMA Token Refresh Rate Register
0x00000010.name: NbiDmaRate

0x00000018.description: NBI DMA BPE Chain End Register
0x00000018.name: NbiDmaBpeChainEnd

0x00000040.description: NBI DMA Buffer Pool Entry %d Configuration
0x00000040.name: NbiDmaBpe%dCfg

0x000000d0.description: Nbi Dma Drop Pkt Counter Low 32-bits
0x000000d0.name: NbiDmaDropPktCntLo

0x000000d4.description: Nbi Dma Drop Pkt Counter High 16-bits
0x000000d4.name: NbiDmaDropPktCntHi

0x000000d8.description: Nbi Dma Drop Byte Counter Low 32-bits
0x000000d8.name: NbiDmaDropByteCntLo

0x000000dc.description: Nbi Dma Drop Byte Counter High 32-bits
0x000000dc.name: NbiDmaDropByteCntHi

0x00000148.description: NBI DMA Buffer Pool CTM Credit Thresholds.
0x00000148.name: NbiDmaBP%dCtmCrThresh

0x00010000.description: NBI DMA Buffer Descriptor SRAM ECC Monitor
0x00010000.name: NbiDmaBDEcc

0x00020000.description: NBI DMA Buffer Completion SRAM ECC Monitor
0x00020000.name: NbiDmaBCEcc

0x00030000.description: NBI DMA State SRAM ECC Monitor . Implemented using 2 ecc_monitor & ecc_monitor2 macro.
0x00030000.name: NbiDmaDSEcc

fields.description: Programmable Null Memory Buffer Pointer.
fields.name: BlqNullMuPtr

fields.description:
When set, selects to use a null buffer descriptor if the packet is not split. The selection can also be made per packet using the preclassifier metadata_0 bits [1;6]
when the BlOverrideEna is set.
fields.name: BlqBypassEna

fields.description: When set, Preclassifier metadata_0 bits [3;3] (PcBlistOverride) are used to select a buffer list override and metadata_0 bits [1;6] (PcBlqBypassEna) selects to use a null buffer descriptor if the packet is not split.
fields.name: BlOverrideEna

fields.description: Selects the number of 32 bytes to add to the allocation size of the packet. Allows padding to the allocated space in the CTM for smaller packets in increments of 32B. 0=32B, 1=64B, 0xf=512B.
fields.name: CtmBufPad

fields.description: Enables adding CtmBufPad bytes to the allocation size of the packet.
fields.name: CtmBufPadEna

fields.description:
When the EnaEnhCtmOffset bit of the NbiDmaCfg register is a zero, this field is not used. 
When EnaEnhCtmOffset is a one, this field represents the MSbits of CtmOffset and defines the offset to add to the data reference when starting to write packet data to the CTM. The space in front of the packet is for the rewrite script used by the packet modifier. Encoding of {CtmOffsetMsb[3;0],CtmOffset} are: 0000 = 32B, 0001=64B, 0010=96B, 0011 = 128B, 0100 = 160B, ... 1111 = 512B
fields.name: CtmOffsetMsb

fields.description: Enables a packet to be dropped when buffer or packet credits run out or there are no MU buffers left on the selected buffer list. When cleared packets are not dropped and the logic backs up waiting for credits to arrive.
fields.name: DropEn

fields.description:
When the EnaEnhCtmOffset bit of the NbiDmaCfg register is a zero, this field controls the CtmOffset in Compatability mode. In Compatability mode a CtmOffset = 0 equates to a CTM offset of 128 Bytes and a CtmOffset = 1 equates to a CTM offset of 64 Bytes. 
When the EnaEnhCtmOffset is a one this field contains the LSbit of CtmOffset. See description of CtmOffsetMsb.
fields.name: CtmOffset

fields.description:
Primary Buffer list number associated. There are 4 buffer lists available, which contain
                 buffer descriptors that are used to store packet data in internal/external MUs.
fields.name: PriBList

fields.description:
Secondary Buffer list number associated. There are 4 buffer lists available, which contain
                 buffer descriptors that are used to store packet data in internal/external MUs.
fields.name: SecBList

fields.description:
Encoded packet size used when deciding to split packets between CTM and internal/external MUs.
                 The encoding is in powers of 2 starting at 256 bytes.
fields.name: SplitLength

fields.description: Pointer to the first Buffer Pool Entry register in the list associated with this buffer pool.
fields.name: BpeHead

fields.description: Configures Threshold2 for the CTM credits. The packet color value is 2b11 if: credit < Threshold2.
fields.name: Threshold2

fields.description: Configures Threshold1 for the CTM credits. The packet color value is 2b10 if: Threshold2  <  credit  < Threshold1.
fields.name: Threshold1

fields.description: Configures Threshold0 for the CTM credits. The packet color value is 2b01 if : Threshold1  <  credit  < Threshold0, else it remains 2b00 if credit > Threshold0.
fields.name: Threshold0

fields.description: Set this bit to disable the BLQ Event FIFO overflow assertion
fields.name: DisBLQEventFifoFullAssert

fields.description: An event is generated every N buffer descriptors read from buffer list queue3, where N is configurable from 16 to 128.
fields.name: BLQEventThreshold3

fields.description: An event is generated every N buffer descriptors read from buffer list queue2, where N is configurable from 16 to 128.
fields.name: BLQEventThreshold2

fields.description: An event is generated every N buffer descriptors read from buffer list queue1, where N is configurable from 16 to 128.
fields.name: BLQEventThreshold1

fields.description: An event is generated every N buffer descriptors read from buffer list queue0, where N is configurable from 16 to 128.
fields.name: BLQEventThreshold0

fields.description:
One bit per buffer list queue. Enables the generation of BLQ Events when the queue transitions from full to not full. Disabled when clear. 
The event type value used is 0x1 (event_type_fifo_not_full)
fields.name: BLQEventNotFullEnable

fields.description: One bit per buffer list queue. Enables BLQ Status Events when set. Disabled when clear. A Status Event is sent when the number of entries read from the queue reaches the programmed value in the BLQEventThreshold register.  The event type value used is 0x5 (event_type_value_update)
fields.name: BLQEventStatusEnable

fields.description: Buffer Pool Entry Number. When the register is written this value is the latched version of the buffer pool register number 0-31. Used for debug purposes.
fields.name: BpeNum

fields.description: CTM number to use
fields.name: Ctm

fields.description: Configures the number of packets allocated to the CTM
fields.name: PktCredit

fields.description: Configures the number of buffer credits in 2K byte increments associated with the CTM. The msbit is the sign bit and must be cleared during configuration.
fields.name: BufCredit

fields.description: Configures BPE module 'n' as the end of the buffer pool entry chain, where 'n' = 0 to 31.
fields.name: BpeChainEnd

fields.description: Upper 32-bits of 64-bit NBI DMA Tx Byte count.  Read this register after reading the NbiDmaByteCntLo register
fields.name: NbiDmaByteCntHi

fields.description: Lower 32-bits of 64-bit NBI DMA Tx Byte count. Reading this register latches the value in NbiDmaByteCntHi register
fields.name: NbiDmaByteCntLo

fields.description: When set, the NBI DMA adds 2-bit packet color in Picoengine metadata based on the CTM's credit level.
fields.name: PacketColorEnable

fields.description: When set, the NBI DMA overrides the Sequence Numbers in the PicoEngine metadata to avoid holes due to drops
fields.name: SeqNumOverride

fields.description: When set, CTM Polling command responses are processed as they arrive. When cleared, CTM Polling command responses are processed after all outstanding responses have arrived
fields.name: PollRespNoWaitEna

fields.description: Controls arbitratin mode of BPE module swapping. Set this bit to enable round-robin mode of arbitration
fields.name: BpeRRArbEna

fields.description: Controls how the CtmOffset field of the NbiDmaBPCfg registers operates.
fields.name: EnaEnhCtmOffset

fields.description: Disables a push bus from being selected by the read arbiter when set. Used to force packet traffic to not use a particular push bus.
fields.name: DisPushBusSelect

fields.description: Controls how the DMA engine handles multi-bit ECC errors received from the Buffer Completion RAM.
fields.name: DisBcRamErr

fields.description: Controls how the DMA engine handles multi-bit ECC errors received from the DMA State RAM.
fields.name: DisDsRamErr

fields.description: Controls how the BLQ logic handles multi-bit ECC errors received from the Buffer Descriptor RAM
fields.name: DisBdRamErr

fields.description: Controls how the hardware forwards the received NBI Buffer Memory Read Error to the output data buses.
fields.name: DisBufRdErr

fields.description: Controls how the hardware responds to a push bus input protocol error for allocation response transactions
fields.name: DisRxPushLastErr

fields.description: Controls how the hardware responds to a push bus input error for allocation response transactions.
fields.name: DisRxAllocInErr

fields.description: Controls how the hardware responds to a push bus input error for BLQ writes transactions.
fields.name: DisRxBlqWrInErr

fields.description:
This field is placed in the 3 lsbits of the Packet Allocation Command Address field. It is used
                            by the CTM to identify which NBI sent the command.
fields.name: NbiNum

fields.description: Configures whether the polling function is enabled or disabled.
fields.name: CtmPollEna

fields.description: Configures the minimum amount of time between packet allocation poll commands in clock cycles.
fields.name: CtmPollIntvl

fields.description: Configures the minimum space between CPP Polling commands issued after the polling interval has expired
fields.name: PollCmdIssueRate

fields.description: Selects whether to limit the bandwidth on the four Push Buses.
fields.name: RateLimitEnable

fields.description: Enable searching for next CTM to poll
fields.name: PollSearchEna

fields.description: Sets the threshold that the leaky bucket is closed. Values are in increments of 16 Credits. A value of 0 equates to 16 credits or 128 bytes. A value of 3 equates to 64 credits or 512 bytes.
fields.name: Threshold3

fields.description: Sets the threshold that the leaky bucket is closed. Values are in increments of 16 Credits. A value of 0 equates to 16 credits or 128 bytes. A value of 3 equates to 64 credits or 512 bytes.
fields.name: Threshold2

fields.description: Sets the threshold that the leaky bucket is closed. Values are in increments of 16 Credits. A value of 0 equates to 16 credits or 128 bytes. A value of 3 equates to 64 credits or 512 bytes.
fields.name: Threshold1

fields.description: Sets the threshold that the leaky bucket is closed. Values are in increments of 16 Credits. A value of 0 equates to 16 credits or 128 bytes. A value of 3 equates to 64 credits or 512 bytes.
fields.name: Threshold0

fields.description: Sets the number of credits to subtract from the leaky bucket for push bus 3. A credit equates to 8-bytes or 1 cycle on the bus. A value of zero equates to 1 credits. A value of 3 equates to 4 credits.
fields.name: Credit3

fields.description: Sets the number of credits to subtract from the leaky bucket for push bus 2. A credit equates to 8-bytes or 1 cycle on the bus. A value of zero equates to 1 credits. A value of 3 equates to 4 credits.
fields.name: Credit2

fields.description: Sets the number of credits to subtract from the leaky bucket for push bus 1. A credit equates to 8-bytes or 1 cycle on the bus. A value of zero equates to 1 credits. A value of 3 equates to 4 credits.
fields.name: Credit1

fields.description: Sets the number of credits to subtract from the leaky bucket for push bus 0. A credit equates to 8-bytes or 1 cycle on the bus. A value of zero equates to 1 credits. A value of 3 equates to 4 credits.
fields.name: Credit0

fields.description: When a packet allocation context becomes active the bit that corresponds to the packet allocation context is set. Clears on read
fields.name: Active

fields.description: Upper 32-bits of 64-bit NBI DMA Drop Byte count. Read this register after reading the NbiDmaDropByteCntLo register
fields.name: NbiDmaDropByteCntHi

fields.description: Lower 32-bits of 64-bit NBI DMA Drop Byte count. Reading this register latches the value in NbiDmaDropByteCntHi register
fields.name: NbiDmaDropByteCntLo

fields.description: Upper 16-bits of 48-bit NBI Drop Packet count. Read this register after reading the NbiDmaDropPktCntLo register
fields.name: NbiDmaDropPktCntHi

fields.description: Lower 32-bits of 48-bit NBI DMA Drop Packet count. Reading this register latches the value in NbiDmaDropPktCntHi register
fields.name: NbiDmaDropPktCntLo

fields.description: Programmed value is threshold 0 in terms of a fraction of CTM Capacity: When the Total Packet Bucket climbs to this threshold the Auto Threshold State Machine transitions from State 0 to State 1.  This value must be largest of the three T#fractions.
fields.name: T0fraction

fields.description: Programmed value is threshold 1 in terms of a fraction of CTM Capacity: When the Total Packet Bucket falls to this threshold the Auto Threshold State Machine transitions from State 1 to State 0.  This value must be between T0fraction and T2fraction.
fields.name: T1fraction

fields.description: Programmed value is threshold 2 in terms of a fraction of CTM Capacity: When the Total Packet Bucket falls to this threshold the Auto Threshold State Machine transitions from State 2 to State 0.  This value must be smallest of the three T#fractions.
fields.name: T2fraction

fields.description: Programmed value controls the number of packets while in State 1 after which the Auto Threshold State Machine will transition from State 1 to State 2
fields.name: AutoThresholdTimeout

fields.description: When programmed to 1, enables the Auto Threshold State Machine to execute the high-level algorithm that periodically re-adjusts the individual port bucket thresholds that govern the per port XON/XOFF flow control
fields.name: AutoThresholdEnable

fields.description: Programmed value controls the XON Hysteresis.  If a port is XOFF'd, the port bucket value must fall this amount below its port bucket threshold before being XON'd
fields.name: XonHysteresis

fields.description: Programmed value controls the maximum number of clocks a port may be XOFF'd. When a port has been off for this duration, it will be XON'd until one packet is seen, after which it will be XOFF'd again if the original XOFF condition exists.  This maximum only has effect while the Auto Threshold State Machine is in State 2.
fields.name: XoffTimer

fields.description: When programmed to 1, enables all the rate meters.  Disabling the rate meters will freeze the values so that they can be read one at a time, but represent a snapshot in time.
fields.name: RateMeterEnable

fields.description: When programmed to a value of N, the rate meters will have a resolution of 1/(2**(15-N)*(CLK PERIOD in secs)*(10**6)) Million Packets Per Sec
fields.name: RateMeterResolution

fields.description: Programmed value is the maximum number of CTM packet credits usable by this NBI
fields.name: CtmCapacity

fields.description: Programmed value provides port index information presented in the three NbiDmaFlowControlPortBucketStatusN registers.
fields.name: Port

fields.description: Measured rate of packets entering the chip through this port.  Value/(32768*(CLK PERIOD in secs)*(10**6)) = Millions of packets/sec
fields.name: Rate

fields.description: Current number of packets being processed that entered through this port.
fields.name: Bucket

fields.description: Value of the credit return accumulator for the indexed port.
fields.name: Accumulator

fields.description: Value of XoffTimer for indexed port associated with the XoffTimer programmable threshold in NbiDmaFlowControlConfig0.
fields.name: XoffTimer

fields.description: State of the Auto Threshold Algorithm
fields.name: AutoThresholdState

fields.description: Current Value of the TimeoutPacketCounter associated with the AutoThresholdTimeOut
fields.name: TimeoutPacketCounter

fields.description: Indicates the total number of packets that are currently being processed in the chip from this NBI
fields.name: TotalPacketsBucket

fields.description: Measured rate of packet credit returns; effectively processing rate. Value/(32768*(CLK PERIOD in secs)*(10**6)) = Millions of packets/sec
fields.name: ReturnCreditRate

fields.description: Measured rate of packets entering the chip through this NBI.  Value/(32768*(CLK PERIOD in secs)*(10**6)) = Millions of packets/sec
fields.name: NewPacketRate

fields.description: When AutoThresholdEnable = 1, this register is read only and reflects the current value of the port threshold set by the high-level algorithm.  When AutoThresholdEnable = 0, the programmed value is used as the port threshold.
fields.name: Threshold

fields.description: Upper 16-bits of 48-bit NBI Tx Packet count. Read this register after reading the NbiDmaPktCntLo register
fields.name: NbiDmaPktCntHi

fields.description: Lower 32-bits of 48-bit NBI DMA Tx Packet count. Reading this register latches the value in NbiDmaPktCntHi register
fields.name: NbiDmaPktCntLo

fields.description: Sets the credit rate for push bus 3. Values are in 4 cycle increments.
fields.name: CreditRate3

fields.description: Sets the credit rate for push bus 2. Values are in 4 cycle increments.
fields.name: CreditRate2

fields.description: Sets the credit rate for push bus 1. Values are in 4 cycle increments.
fields.name: CreditRate1

fields.description: Sets the credit rate for push bus 0. Values are in 4 cycle increments.
fields.name: CreditRate0

fields.description: Sequence Numbers (0..4095)
fields.name: NbiDmaSeqNum

fields.description: General use register.
fields.name: NbiDmaSpare
